recipe.name: Venetian Duck Ragu
recipe.description: A rich and flavorful Italian pasta sauce made with tender duck meat simmered in red wine, tomatoes, and aromatic herbs, traditionally served over paccheri pasta.
steps: Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the duck legs and brown on all sides for about 10 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add the finely chopped onions and cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute.
Stir in the ground cinnamon and plain flour, cooking for another minute.
Return the duck legs to the pan and pour in the red wine, chopped tomatoes, and crumbled chicken stock cube.
Add the rosemary sprigs, bay leaves, sugar, and season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Carefully remove the duck legs from the sauce. Discard the skin and bones, then shred the meat using two forks.
Return the shredded duck meat to the sauce, stir in the milk, and simmer uncovered for an additional 10-15 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the paccheri pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain, reserving a cup of the pasta water.
Add the cooked pasta to the ragu, stirring to coat. If the sauce is too thick, add some reserved pasta water to adjust the consistency.
Serve immediately, topped with grated Parmesan cheese.
Take a moment to appreciate your creation, then enjoy!
